metadata.feature_description: Provides integration point for Evoq Assistant chat feature within PersonaBar.

steps.action: Logged into the DNN site as superuser (host)
steps.actual: Login successful. PersonaBar is visible on the left side with menu items: Dashboard, Content, Manage, Page Analytics, Settings, Accounts

steps.action: Examined all PersonaBar menu items for Assistant entry point
steps.expected: An 'Assistant' menu item or chat icon should be visible in the PersonaBar
steps.actual: No 'Assistant' menu item found in the PersonaBar. Available items are: Dashboard, Content, Manage, Page Analytics, Settings, Accounts, Edit toggle

steps.action: Navigated to Settings > Extensions > Persona Bar to verify if Evoq.Assistant extension is installed
steps.expected: Evoq.Assistant or similar extension should be listed
steps.actual: No Evoq.Assistant or Evoq.PersonaBar.Assistant extension is installed. Listed extensions include: Dnn.PersonaBar.Extensions, Evoq.PersonaBar.AccountSettings, Assets, CommunityAnalytics, CommunitySettings, Forms, Gamification, Licensing, Microservices, PageAnalytics, Pages, Recyclebin, Servers, SiteAnalytics, Sites, SiteSettings, StructuredContent, Templates, Users, Workflow - but NO Assistant module

issues: The Evoq Assistant module/extension is not installed in this environment. The EvoqPersonaBarContainer.cs code provides an integration point for the Assistant (lines 140-146), but the actual Assistant module package is required for the feature to be available. Without the Evoq.Assistant extension installed, the Assistant chat feature cannot be initialized or tested.

observations: Code analysis of EvoqPersonaBarContainer.cs (lines 140-146) confirms that the Assistant integration requires: (1) Valid Evoq license via LicenseHelper.HasLicense(), (2) 'Evoq.Assistant' menu item registered in PersonaBarRepository, (3) User VIEW permission for the assistant menu item
The Evoq.Assistant module appears to be a separate package/extension that must be installed independently from the base Evoq.PersonaBar.UI extension
The integration point exists in the code base, but the actual Assistant functionality requires the Evoq.Assistant module which is not present in this test environment

The code references '../Modules/Evoq.Assistant/Scripts/AssistantChat' which would be loaded as a custom module when conditions are met, but this path does not exist without the Assistant module installed
